Package org.neo4j.internal.index.label

Class NativeTokenScanWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.internal.index.label.NativeTokenScanWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, TokenScanWriter
    class NativeTokenScanWriter
extends Object
implements TokenScanWriter
    TokenScanWriter for NativeTokenScanStore, or rather a Writer for its internal GBPTree.

    updates are queued up to a maximum batch size and, for performance, applied in sorted order (by the token and entity id) when reaches batch size or on close().

    Updates aren't visible to readers immediately, rather when queue happens to be applied.

    Incoming updates are actually modified from representing physical before/after state to represent logical to-add/to-remove state. These changes are done directly inside the provided EntityTokenUpdate.getTokensAfter() and EntityTokenUpdate.getTokensBefore() arrays, relying on the fact that those arrays are returned in its essential form, instead of copies. This conversion is done like so mostly to reduce garbage.

    See Also:
    PhysicalToLogicalTokenChanges

    • Field Detail

      • UPDATE_SORTER

        private static final Comparator<EntityTokenUpdate> UPDATE_SORTER
        Comparator for sorting the entity id ranges, used in batches to apply updates in sorted order.

      • addMerger

        private final ValueMerger<TokenScanKey,​TokenScanValue> addMerger
        ValueMerger used for adding token->entity mappings, see TokenScanValue.add(TokenScanValue).

      • removeMerger

        private final ValueMerger<TokenScanKey,​TokenScanValue> removeMerger
        ValueMerger used for removing token->entity mappings, see TokenScanValue.remove(TokenScanValue).

      • monitor

        private final NativeTokenScanWriter.WriteMonitor monitor

      • writer

        private Writer<TokenScanKey,​TokenScanValue> writer
        Writer acquired when acquiring this NativeTokenScanWriter, acquired from GBPTree.writer(PageCursorTracer).

      • key

        private final TokenScanKey key
        Instance of TokenScanKey acting as place to read keys into and to set for each applied update.

      • value

        private final TokenScanValue value
        Instance of TokenScanValue acting as place to read values into and to update for each applied update.

      • pendingUpdates

        private final EntityTokenUpdate[] pendingUpdates
        Batch currently building up as updates come in. Cursor for where to place new updates is pendingUpdatesCursor. The constructor set the length of this queue and the length defines the maximum batch size.

      • pendingUpdatesCursor

        private int pendingUpdatesCursor
        Cursor into pendingUpdates, where to place new updates. When full the batch is applied and this cursor reset to 0.

      • addition

        private boolean addition
        There are two levels of batching, one for updates and one when applying. This variable helps keeping track of the second level where updates to the actual GBPTree are batched per entity id range, i.e. to add several tokenId->entityId mappings falling into the same range, all of those updates are made into one TokenScanValue and then issues as one update to the tree. There are additions and removals, this variable keeps track of which.

      • lowestTokenId

        private long lowestTokenId
        When applying updates (when batch full or in close()), updates are applied tokenId by tokenId. All updates are scanned through multiple times, with one token in mind at a time. For each round the current round tries to figure out which is the closest higher tokenId to apply in the next round. This variable keeps track of that next tokenId.

      • EMPTY

        static final NativeTokenScanWriter.WriteMonitor EMPTY
